children.subject: I haven't taken 184 but it seems pretty project-heavy so by default it's hard to force yourself to both learn the concepts and also get the experience from do the projects. Also, 170 has a really good textbook which I used a lot in the class to review concepts or relearn them so I can see 170 being easier to self study but both seem like pretty tough classes to self-study.
I also haven't taken 184, so can't comment on that either, but if it's a project-based class i'd think it'd be less easier to self-study it.
The non-mathy parts of 170 (DP, Greedy, Trees, BFS/DFS) can be easily self-studied. The rest I can't comment on, since I didn't really care for them before, during or after taking the course lol

I've taken 184 in the past, and I'm currently enrolled in 170 right now. I managed to successfully prepare for bits and pieces of 170 over the summer (the textbook's really good), but I couldn't exactly self-study 184 because it's very project focused. I did look over the website, but it didn't really make sense to self-study. Personally, I don't recommend self-studying either because taking the courses is much better than just prepping on your own, but to settle your argument, I think 170's easier to self-study.

The lectures are just giving out examples of different algorithms, and let you 1) design algorithms to solve problems 2) answer a lot of tricky questions on the exams. Also reservoir sampling is a bit useful, but it's also really easy to be self-studied by doing some specific problems on leetcode.

170 is definitely self-studyable. I am currently taking this course and I kind of regret about taking it. I already self-learnt greedy and DP, did leetcode problems, and have got offers from top tech companies & hedge funds, but still can't really do well on the exams. The exams meant to trick you actually, and the other parts besides greedy and DP are not useful unless you want to do a PhD in theory. Don't take it if you are not a very strong algorithm thinker.
170 is your best bet. You can go and download the book/notes from the cs170 website and go over it during the winter break.

history.content: Trying to settle an argument with a friend; Is it easier to self-study CS 170 or CS 184? Thanks!
history.subject: Self-study 170 or 184?
